title: chore: release 0.5.1
body: This release _just_ bumps wasmtime to a version that builds on aarch64.

body: I'm hoping this will fix builds on linux/arm64.

title: Release fvm 0.5.0, fvm_shared 0.4.1
body: Technically, the fvm_shared release is a breaking change. But it won't impact any creates that actually _rely_ on 0.4.0 (the actors, and only the actors) and I just released it yesterday.

title: fix: mark NetworkVersion as non-exhaustive
body: That way changing this isn't a breaking change.

title: chore: release shared to propagate refactor
fix: format imports
body: This should have been caught by CI pre-merge... but wasn't.

title: add V16 to network version
body: Needed for FIP0031 implementation in filecoin-ffi.

title: Optimize RLE+ decoding by 20%
body:
```
decode                  time:   [15.350 us 15.388 us 15.440 us]                    
                        change: [-19.388% -19.130% -18.910%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)
                        Performance has improved.

decode_encode           time:   [30.458 us 30.542 us 30.659 us]                           
                        change: [-13.335% -13.014% -12.640%] (p = 0.00 < 0.05)
                        Performance has improved.
```

title: chore: address: Cleanup BLS address logic
fix: enforce max bitfield size on decode
body:
Honestly, we probably _don't_ need this in the FVM because:

1. Malicious inputs will burn gas for compute and won't be able to OOM the node.
2. Large bitfields will fail to serialize to state anyways.

However, I'd like relaxing this check to be an explicit step.

Fixes C1.

title: doc: explain call-stack-depth logic
body:
The ordering of the checks here, and the comparison, are confusing (and
arguably incorrect but we're following the spec).

title: refactor: split encoding and blockstore into fvm_ipld_* crates
body:
- move `shared/encoding` into `ipld/encoding`
- move `shared/blockstore` into `ipld/blockstore`
- remove dependency on `fvm_shared` for all `ipld/*` crates

title: test: add context to conformance test errors
Run clippy, fmt on fuzz targets and fix rle_encode corpus symlink
Set some wasmtime config settings
body: This sets most of the basic settings (even if they are the same as defaults in case those change in a wasmtime update)

title: chore: release fvm_ipld_bitfield 0.4.0
body:
This version is incompatible with previous versions due to a few changed
function signatures, and stricter validation. Continue using 0.3.0 to
validate networks before nv16.

title: chore: release fvm_shared
body: This time, we're returning the right errors.

title: Add RLE fuzzing
body:
decode-encode loop is currently disabled due to https://github.com/filecoin-project/ref-fvm/pull/409

I'm not happy with the directory structure, the cargo-fuzz requires
that there is a parent crate for every `fuzz` crate which makes things a bit
annoying.

title: fix: remove cbor serde error from everywhere
body: The previous patch only removed it from to_vec, but we need to do this everywhere.

title: chore: release everything
body: Otherwise we have two different versions.

title: chore: release fvm_shared 0.3.0
body:
It's a minor release because it removes something that shouldn't have
been exported in the first place (breaking change).

title: fix: don't leak underlying library error
body:
The error of the underlying CBOR library is an implementation detail,
it shouldn't leak into the public API. Instead use the error that
wraps it into the one specified by the module.

title: feat: switch to the new versioned manifest.
body:
1. If no manifest CID is passed, load the manifest from the system actor and assume "v1" for now. In the future, we'll likely use the network version to infer the manifest version.
2. If a manifest CID _is_ passed, assume it's a versioned manifest and use the specified version.

replaces #404

title: Improve AMT equivalance fuzzer
body: Remove simple AMT fuzzing as the equivalence fuzzer now does its work better.

title: Derive Debug for PieceInfo
body: This is wanted for the built-in actors mock runtime.

title: Invalidate SSCACHE on github
body:
Current SSCACHE is stuck due to: https://github.com/actions/toolkit/issues/658
as seen within https://github.com/filecoin-project/ref-fvm/runs/5711220587?check_suite_focus=true in `Post Setting up cache`
The simplest solution is to invalidate it by switching the start of the cache key to v1.

title: Add clusterfuzzlite integration
body:
It will fuzz on PR (if relevant code is changed), batch fuzz in the background,
produce fuzzing coverage reports and prune the corpus.

The aim of ClusterfuzzLite is to detect newly introduced regressions caused by code changes.

title: Add fuzzing corpus
body: Add fuzzing corpus as submodule

title: Cleanup fuzz test naming and add equivalence AMT test
body: Change in the naming is because I plan add project specific prefix to fuzz targets within OSS-Fuzz

title: Fix AMT fuzzing
body: We need to setup CI for the future.

title: Release v0.2.1
body: Of the FVM, shared crate, and the sdk. Primarily, this completely removes the "identity" multihash feature.

title: builtin actor registry in system actor
body:
for https://github.com/filecoin-project/builtin-actors/issues/122
companion to https://github.com/filecoin-project/builtin-actors/pull/132

title: improve code documentation & fix some clippy lints
code and docs cleanup round
body: Minor cleanup round to confuse auditors a bit less.

title: chore: update test vectors
body: This adds the nv15 test vectors.

title: chore: update readme.
body: - Remove reference to actors, which now live in https://github.com/filecoin-project/builtin-actors.

title: feat(bitfield): add optimized last
body:
And refactor "first" to behave the same way.

Fixes the second point of https://github.com/filecoin-project/builtin-actors/issues/55.

title: Switch price_list_by_epoch to price_list_by_network_version
body: Although this has no practical consequence today (there's only one PriceList in the FVM), this future-proofs us so that the evil that is `price_list_by_epoch` may not endure.

title: feat: add nv15 support to conformance test framework
body: Fixes https://github.com/filecoin-project/ref-fvm/issues/370.

title: remove `examples` subtree.
body: This was useful to demo components as they were being fleshed out in the first days, but it's outdated, we no longer use it, and it's confusing to have it here (and with that name). Removing this also allows us to simplify the workspace Cargo.toml.

title: fix: remove uses of Code::Identity and remove the multihash feature
body:
This feature is, to put it simply, very dangerous as it will panic when given more than 64 bytes of input. See https://github.com/multiformats/rust-multihash/issues/194

Given that all uses of the identity hash function should be special cased _anyways_, there's no reason to leave this foot-gun in place.

title: chore: use released actors in the conformance tests
Release 0.2.0
body:
- Initial nv15 support.
- Switches to the new IPLD libraries. Mostly hack-free at this point.

title: fix: use a different CBOR library
body:
Use a CBOR library that is tailored towards DAG-CBOR.

CIDs don't work as expected with Serde untagged enums, hence add a custom
implementation for the Pointer (de)serialization. That implementation works
similarly to the Serde untagged enum implementation.

First the data is deserialized into a common format that supports all types.
In our case that's `Ipld`, in Serde it's `Content`. Those are then converted
into the actual types the enum is using.

Directly converting from the serialized form into the concrete enum types is
not possible. One would need to try each of the possibilities sequentially
until one of them matches. The deserializer is consumed when deserializing,
hence it can only be used once. This is the reason to have the intermediate
step.

title: Support nv15
body:
Rebased for builtin-actors extraction.

Closes https://github.com/filecoin-project/ref-fvm/issues/335.
Closes #143.
Closes https://github.com/filecoin-project/ref-fvm/issues/336.

title: chore:add action to add new issue to the project board
body: Default status as todo

title: depend on v6 branch of actors.
prepare to publish crates; v0.1.0.
body:
- rename `ipld_{amt,hamt,car,bitfield}` to `fvm_ipld_...`. The `ipld_` namespace is taken by the original crates, and these forks depend on `fvm_shared`, so it's logical to namespace them under `fvm_`.
- add version numbers to all dependencies.
- add missing metadata to Cargo.toml.

title: update maturity status to beta
body: According to the maturity roadmap specified in the README, ref-fvm is at beta stage.

title: extract actors to `filecoin-project/canonical-actors`
body:
This is the ref-fvm side of https://github.com/filecoin-project/builtin-actors/issues/4. To be paired with the [`raulk/initial` branch](https://github.com/filecoin-project/builtin-actors/tree/raulk/initial) on https://github.com/filecoin-project/builtin-actors.

- Removes actors code from this repo.
- Renames `{forest=>ipld}_bitfield`.
- Introduces the `actor::is_builtin_actor` syscall.
- Introduces the `actor::get_code_cid_for_type` syscall.
- Makes the Machine load Wasm bytecode from the blockstore.
- Makes `testing/conformance` import `builtin-actors` v6.
- Adds the `fvm_shared::actor::builtin` module with types to support the loading of builtin actor code and the resolution of CIDs.

title: feat: optimize actor loading
body:
- cache syscall linker and constructed syscalls
- cache "pre instantiated" modules

This reduces conformance test run time from ~600s to ~100s on my machine and significantly increases network sync performance.

title: fix: exclude test-vectors submodule from crate
body: Related to #344, but this doesn't fix it (see the linked cargo issue).

title: clean child in link node only if child is deleted
body: Ran into an issue when attempting to sync calibnet on Forest. Seems to prevent panics and allows the node to sync up to the network

title: feat: remove a block copy on read
body:
By using a `Box` instead of an `Rc`. We had an `Rc` to facilitate sharing (immutable) blocks between actors, but we never used it for that _anyways_.

Also make the block fields private.

title: update readme
body: Update the milestone name to match the roadmap shared in https://filecoin.io/blog/posts/introducing-the-filecoin-virtual-machine/ (which uses Phase 0/1/2/3/4 instead of M0/1/2/3)

title: fix: charge gas for state access when resolving a key address
body:
But don't charge when looking up the "origin" key, to be consistent with lotus.

partially addresses #319

title: allow the verify consensus fault extern to return gasused

milestone.title: M0
milestone.description: Canary launch of non-programmable FVM on mainnet, behind a feature flag or fork of the reference implementation (Lotus), running only system actors. Compatible with the existing chain and requiring no protocol upgrade.

body: Addresses #319
